Entities.Name: Pulmonary Nodule
Entities.Definition: A type of 'diagnosis' entity identified by the NER system, considered significant for clinical evaluations.

Sample Data.Text: Figure 4 presents various diagnosis entities considered equivalent to the pulmonary nodule class...
Sample Data.Annotated Example: The annotation includes entities like pulmonary nodules >6 mm, linked with measurements for specific relevance.

Dataset.Name: SapienNER Dataset
Dataset.Details: Composed of 9165 de-identified CT imaging reports, manually reviewed and categorized, including unstructured and structured reports. The dataset was used to test the NER systemâ€™s efficacy in detecting pulmonary nodules from the reports.

Annotation Guidelines.Text: The guidelines include specific inclusion and exclusion criteria for pulmonary nodules, based on the Fleischner Society Criteria for nodule significance.
Annotation Guidelines.Link: The paper does not provide a direct link to the annotation guidelines but references them in the description of the method used.
